intro: Neochilenia mitis, commonly known as the Chilean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Neochilenia mitis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained conditions.
